page.title: 14FARMING at SACOMBE
page.content: Mr.Michael Pratt is the Gamekeeper of Sacombebury Farm in Sacombe. He is salaried and works for a man in London. The gamekeeper's job is to rear pheasants and other game birds for the shooting season. The pheasants are kept in an enclosed field and the eggs are collected three times a day. They are then washed and taken to a hatchery. At one day old the pheasants are taken back to the farm and kept in heated sheds for three weeks. After that they spend seven to eight weeks in the field before being released into the wild. Pheasant eggs can be brown right through to blue.To stop the hens eating their eggs red plastic beak covers are put on them. Jackdaws and crows are pests that would pinch the eggs so there are deterrents to stop them. The hens are fed on breeders pellets.
